headline: YouTube’s founders split over $650 million when they sold to Google in 2006—had they held out, they could have taken a slice of $550 billion
summary: YouTube’s cofounders could all be part of the billionaire club alongside Google's Sundar Pichai had they kept the business—it’s grown some 333x since they cashed out.

headline: India orders blocking of 25 streaming platforms for "obscene content", source says
summary: (Reuters) -India has ordered blocking public access to 25 streaming platforms, including Balaji Telefilms-owned 'ALTT' for alleged obscene, vulgar and in some cases, pornographic content, a government official said on Friday.  Besides 'ALTT', other streaming platforms that were also banned were smaller, including players such as Ullu and Hulchul, according to the government official.  India has previously told streaming platforms, including Netflix, Disney and others, that their content should be independently reviewed for obscenity and violence before being shown online.

headline: Disney Stock Is Ready to Rally After a Lost Decade
summary: It has been a lost decade for the entertainment giant. But with TV declines baked in and growth improving, the stock is ready for a new era.
